revised_title: The Identification and Estimation of Cystine in Proteins
tldr: The authors developed a new method to estimate and isolate cystine in proteins, specifically in ovalbumin and serum albumin. They found that the preponderating fraction of sulfur in serum albumin is combined as cystine, while in ovalbumin, it is in a form other than cystine. This research contributes to understanding the structure and composition of proteins.
